meanings.definition: To make something appear fuller or softer by shaking or patting it.
meanings.sent1: She fluffed the pillow before lying down for a nap.
meanings.sent2: The baker fluffed the flour before adding it to the cake batter.
meanings.sent3: The cat fluffed its fur to impress the other animals in the pet show.
meanings.sent4: The magician fluffed the scarf, making it look like it was floating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The actor fluffed the costume to make it look more extravagant on stage.

meanings.definition: To fail to perform or accomplish something successfully.
meanings.sent1: He fluffed his lines during the school play and felt embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: The soccer player fluffed the penalty kick, missing the goal by a mile.
meanings.sent3: She fluffed the presentation, forgetting to include the most important information.
meanings.sent4: The chef fluffed the souffle, causing it to collapse in the oven.
meanings.sent5: The student fluffed the exam, leaving most of the questions unanswered.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error in a performance or task.
meanings.sent1: The singer fluffed the high note during the concert, but recovered quickly.
meanings.sent2: The comedian fluffed the punchline, resulting in awkward silence from the audience.
meanings.sent3: He fluffed the recipe, adding salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: The goalkeeper fluffed the save, letting the ball slip through his fingers.
meanings.sent5: The driver fluffed the parallel parking, bumping into the car behind.
